meanings.definition: Grizes (verb): to make a low, guttural sound
meanings.sent1: The lion grizes loudly in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: I heard a strange animal grizes in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The grizing cat startled the birds in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The old engine grizes like a tired bear waking up.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm grizes ominously in the dark sky.

meanings.sent1: The grizes of the engine filled the garage.
meanings.sent2: A deep grizes echoed through the cave.
meanings.sent3: The grizes of the old man's snoring kept everyone awake.
meanings.sent4: The grizes of the wind sounded like a ghostly whisper.
meanings.sent5: The grizes of the thunder made the ground tremble.

meanings.definition: Grizes (adjective): having a low, guttural quality
meanings.sent1: The grizes voice of the storyteller captivated the children.
meanings.sent2: The grizes growl of the bear warned us to stay away.
meanings.sent3: The grizes music of the band made everyone dance.
meanings.sent4: The grizes engine of the old car struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent5: The grizes laughter of the old man filled the room with warmth.
